title: 103_hr299
content: Establishment of Commission on Environment and Development (referred to as the "Commission") with defined functions. The Commission shall monitor signatories' compliance with UN environmental goals and encourage programs for advancing these objectives. The Commission, established to monitor compliance with UN environmental goals, will review reports from countries, including the United States. It will also consult with various organizations and bodies concerned with environmental and sustainable development issues. It will also consult with various organizations and bodies concerned with environmental and sustainable development issues. SEC. 3. MEMBERSHIP OF COMMISSION. The Commission consists of 11 members, including four members from the House of Representatives and four members from the Senate, appointed based on party affiliation. Additionally, the Assistant Secretary of State for Oceans and International Environmental and Scientific Affairs, the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, and the Chairman of the Council on Environmental Quality are also part of the Commission. The Commission includes 11 members from the House and Senate, appointed by party affiliation. The Chair and Cochair are designated at the beginning of each Congress by the Speaker of the House and the President of the Senate, respectively. The Speaker of the House designates a House Member as Cochair of the Commission. SEC. 4. REPORTS TO AND BY THE COMMISSION. The President shall submit semiannual reports to the Commission detailing actions by UN signatories and executive branch programs related to the goals of the United Nations Conference on Environment and Development. The Commission will report periodically to Congress on these matters and provide information upon request. The Commission has the power to subpoena witnesses and documents as needed for investigations. It can also hire staff who are considered congressional employees for pay and benefits. Authorization of appropriations is also granted. Authorization of appropriations is granted to the Commission for each fiscal year to carry out the Act.
